title: FABER Workflow Schema
description: JSON Schema for FABER workflow files. Workflows can extend other workflows via the 'extends' field, creating an inheritance chain where parent pre_steps run before and post_steps run after child workflow steps.

$schema.description: JSON Schema reference for IDE validation

extends.description: Parent workflow to extend. Use namespaced format: 'fractary-faber:default' for core workflows, or unnamespaced for project workflows. Parent pre_steps execute before child steps, parent post_steps execute after.

skip_steps.description: Step IDs from parent workflows to skip. Allows selective exclusion of inherited steps without abandoning the entire parent workflow.

hooks.description: DEPRECATED: Use pre_steps and post_steps in phase definitions instead. Hooks will be removed in v3.0.

pre_steps.description: Steps to execute BEFORE child workflow steps. In inheritance, parent pre_steps run before child pre_steps.

steps.description: Main phase steps. These are the core steps for this phase.

post_steps.description: Steps to execute AFTER child workflow steps. In inheritance, child post_steps run before parent post_steps.

max_retries.description: Maximum retry attempts for this phase

require_approval.description: Whether this phase requires explicit approval

id.description: Unique step identifier (lowercase, hyphens allowed). MUST be unique across the entire merged workflow (including inherited steps). Required for step targeting, logging, state tracking, and skip_steps.

name.description: Human-readable display name for the step.

description.description: Human-readable step documentation (what this step does)

prompt.description: Execution instruction for Claude when no skill is present, or to customize skill behavior. Takes precedence over description for execution.

config.description: Step-specific configuration passed to the skill

arguments.description: Explicit arguments to pass to the step. Keys are argument names (exact casing), values are literals or {placeholder} references to workflow context.

hooks.description: DEPRECATED: Use pre_steps and post_steps in phase definitions instead.

hook.description: DEPRECATED: Convert to pre_steps or post_steps instead.

path.description: Path to document or script (required for document and script types)

autonomy.description: Autonomy configuration for workflow execution. Supports both legacy 'level' and new two-dimensional model (check_in_frequency + tolerance).

level.description: DEPRECATED: Legacy autonomy level. Use check_in_frequency and tolerance settings instead. Kept for backward compatibility - will be auto-migrated to new model.

check_in_frequency.description: How often to pause for review. 'per-step' = after every step, 'per-phase' = after each phase, 'end-only' = only at workflow end.

warning_tolerance.description: Maximum warning severity to tolerate without stopping. 'none' = stop on any warning, 'low' = continue past low-severity, 'medium' = continue past low and medium, 'high' = continue past all (dangerous).

error_tolerance.description: Maximum error severity to tolerate without stopping. 'none' = stop on any error (recommended), 'low' = continue past low-severity errors only. Higher values are dangerous.

description.description: Human-readable description of the autonomy configuration

pause_before_release.description: DEPRECATED: Use check_in_frequency instead. Pause before release phase for approval.

require_approval_for.description: List of phases requiring explicit approval regardless of check_in_frequency

phase_autonomy_override.description: Phase-specific autonomy settings that override global defaults

check_in_frequency.description: Override check-in frequency for this phase

warning_tolerance.description: Override warning tolerance for this phase

error_tolerance.description: Override error tolerance for this phase

global_limits.description: Global limits for workflow execution to prevent runaway issues

max_total_warnings.description: Maximum total warnings before workflow stops (default: 50)

max_total_errors.description: Maximum total errors before workflow stops (default: 20)

on_limit_reached.description: Behavior when limit is reached. 'stop' = halt workflow, 'truncate' = stop collecting but continue workflow.

step_result_handling.description: Defines behavior for step execution outcomes. Optional - if omitted, defaults are: on_success='continue', on_warning='continue', on_failure='stop'. on_failure is ALWAYS 'stop' (immutable).

on_success.description: Action when step succeeds: 'continue' proceeds automatically (default), 'prompt' asks user

on_warning.description: Action when step has warnings: 'continue' proceeds (default), 'prompt' asks user with options, 'stop' halts workflow

on_failure.description: IMMUTABLE: Failure ALWAYS stops workflow execution. This cannot be changed. Default: 'stop'

hook_result_handling.description: DEPRECATED: Defines behavior for hook execution outcomes.

on_success.description: Action when hook succeeds: 'continue' proceeds automatically (default), 'prompt' asks user

on_warning.description: Action when hook has warnings: 'continue' proceeds (default), 'prompt' asks user with options, 'stop' halts workflow

on_failure.description: Action when hook fails: 'stop' halts workflow (default), 'continue' for informational hooks only

step_result.description: Standard result structure that ALL steps must return. See plugins/faber/config/schemas/skill-response.schema.json for complete schema.

status.description: Execution outcome status: 'success' = goal achieved, 'warning' = goal achieved with concerns, 'failure' = goal NOT achieved

message.description: Human-readable summary of what happened (1-2 sentences)

details.description: Operation-specific structured data (artifacts, metrics, paths, etc.)

errors.description: List of error messages (required when status is 'failure')

warnings.description: List of warning messages (required when status is 'warning')

error_analysis.description: Root cause analysis for failures - explains what went wrong and why

warning_analysis.description: Impact assessment for warnings - explains potential consequences

suggested_fixes.description: Actionable recovery suggestions, ordered by likelihood of success
